bibl.title: Callimachus and His Critics.
bibl.note: "Much of the book is in fact more a prolegomena to the study of Hellenistic (and also Roman) poetry than a study of Callimachus alone. It is a social as much as a literary history of Greek poetry in the early third century."
bibl.seg: CAMERON Alan, Callimachus and His Critics.
Princeton, New Jersey, Princeton University Press, 1995, 8Â°, xiv-534 pp. ISBN 0-691-04367-1. $37.50.

"Much of the book is in fact more a prolegomena to the study of Hellenistic (and also Roman) poetry than a study of Callimachus alone. It is a social as much as a literary history of Greek poetry in the early third century."

C.R. par Fritz Bornmann, AeR N.S., 41 (1996) p. 129. - Jerry Clack, CW 91 (1997-1998) pp. 304-305. - Adele-Teresa Cozzoli, Eikasmos 9 (1998) pp. 135-154. - Frederick T. Griffiths, AJP 118 (1997) pp. 339-343. - Virginia Knight, CR N.S., 48 (1998) pp. 275-277. - P.E. Knox, EMC 40 (1996) pp. 413-424. - Annette Harder, Mnemosyne 4a s., 55 (2002) pp. 599-608.
